results.title: Industrial chemistry
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Industrial chemists are employed in diverse industries, ranging from the production of soaps and detergents to plastics, petrol and paints. The chemist who has a suitable temperament and knowledge can also enter into the technical sales side.

results.title: Industrial Canada
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary account of Canada’s industrial development. The film traces the country’s transformation from a strictly agricultural economy to an increasingly industrial one, commenting on the impetus given by World War II. The Canada of today presents a diversity of industrial activity, with rich natural resources of every description forming the basis of export and manufacture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy L. Cote and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Inductors
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical Induction and Capacity”.
A soft iron core introduced into a coil carrying an alternating current shows what is meant by self-induction. Diagrams explain the working of choke and illustrate the effects of varying frequency. The effect of an inductor on the make and break of a circuit and its application in the starting of a fluorescent lamp is shown. Illustrates applications of inductors in bells, fluorescent tubes, signals and other electrical equipment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park

results.title: Indonesia: time to grow
results.brief_description: This film centres on the trip to the market of an Indonesian farmer, Sukanta, and his ten year old son, Djuki. They live in a village four miles from the rapidly growing city of Jakarta. Farm and village life are seen in reflective scenes, and city life is seen through the eyes of Djuki as he accompanies his elder brother, Suriana, a scholarship student at the university, on a walking tour of Jakarta.

results.title: Indonesia: time of transition
results.creator_credit: Peter Drummond and Beaumaris Film Productions
results.brief_description: A look at the contrasts to be found in Indonesia. Shows life in Djakarta, the island of Bali, subsistence farming, and Western influences on the traditional culture. Mentions the new spirit of nationalism, the role of the students and the high birth rate. Interviews two military commanders who talk about the political situation.

results.title: Indonesia: the land and the people
results.brief_description: A survey of the Republic of Indonesia, including its geographical location, weather, soil, and agriculture. Mention is made of the population, of the different religions, languages, and crafts; the unique life with dancing and music daily, the use of the market place, and the cluster of homes of members of one clan. Products of the country are pictured and stress placed on importance of foreign trade.

results.title: Sumatra: island of the Bataks

Episode of Series “Indonesia”
Daily life of the Batak people of Samesir Island in Lake Toba, Sumatra, a farming and fishing economy.

results.title: Sumatra: island of rice and rubber
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”
Scenes of life in Sumatra, one of the many islands of Indonesia. Shows the agricultural development and methods used by the rural population. Village life style and customs are also seen.

results.title: Indonesia: new nation of Asia
results.creator_credit: William Deneen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An Indonesian teacher tells the story of his country. Traces the history of Indonesia from Dutch rule to independence; shows life in crowded cities and in the home of village families; examines the natural resources, religions, art and industries of the country, pointing out how living standards are improving.
results.description: An Indonesian teacher tells the story of his country. results.title: Java: island of volcanoes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Showing life in Java, the rich and varied agricultural economy, which thrives in the lush tropical climate and Djakarta, the large bustling capital city of both the island and the nation. The film also depicts the numerous volcanoes of the island and discusses their significance to the people living near them. Narrated by Roger Climpson.
